instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00239 R7075 still shorting to the ground after replacing it.
threads.message:
The R7075 was 67ohm which should be 4.7ohms ,with alcohol heat test show the r7075 is boiling , i replaced R7075 from the same donor board which i get now 5.1ohms which sound about right .
but this R7075 still  boiling with the same test , PPDCIN only 5.2 pp3v3_g3h 0 volt . PPBUS_G3H 0 volt . 
when check short to ground this Resistor still shorting . do i need to replace U7000 ?

threads.title: 820-00239 R7075 still shorting to the ground after replacing it.
threads.message:
Short on TBA_VDDA.
Check C7075 first, but pretty sure to be U7000.

Always check for short before power up a board.
No need voltage to find a short.
Now you must change R7075 again...
